056import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
057import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_List;
058import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_Object;
059import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_String;
060import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_boolean;
061import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.DEFAULT_NAME;
062import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.FALSE;
063import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.NULL;
064import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.TRUE;

066import static java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc.Kind.STATIC;

068import static org.microbean.path.ConstantDescs.CD_Path;

071import static org.microbean.qualifier.ConstantDescs.CD_Qualifiers;

073/**
074 * A {@linkplain Qualified qualified} sequence of {@linkplain
075 * Path.Element named and qualified elements} that "points to" an
076 * object and that can be used for many different purposes.
077 *
078 * <p>A {@link Path} can be used like a {@link javax.naming.Name
079 * javax.naming.Name}, or like a {@link java.nio.file.Path
080 * java.nio.file.Path}, or like a {@link java.net.URI java.net.URI}.
081 * It differs from these other objects in that it combines some of
082 * their concepts together.</p>
083 *
084 * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}; most notably
085 * <strong>not necessarily</strong> the type of the thing the {@link
086 * Path} "points to"; more like an additional qualifier
087 *
088 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
089 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
090 *
091 * @see Path.Element
092 */
093public final class Path<T> implements Iterable<Path.Element<?>>, Qualified<String, Object, T> {
094
095
096  /*
097   * Static fields.
098   */
099
100
101  private static final StackWalker stackWalker = StackWalker.getInstance();
102
103  private static final Path<?> ROOT = new Path<>();
104
105  private static final char PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR = '.';
106
107  private static final String PREFIX_SEPARATOR = "" + PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR;
108
109
110  /*
111   * Instance fields.
112   */
113
114
115  private final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers;
116
117  private final List<Element<?>> elements;
118
119  private final boolean transliterated;
120
121
122  /*
123   * Constructors.
124   */
125
126
127  // For use by ROOT only.
128  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
129  private Path() {
130    this(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), (Element<T>)Element.root(), true);
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Creates a new {@link Path}.
135   *
136   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement last element} of
137   * this {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
138   *
139   * @exception NullPointerException if any parameter is {@code null}
140   *
141   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
142   */
143  public Path(final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
144    this(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), lastElement, false);
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Creates a new {@link Path}.
149   *
150   * @param qualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers()
151   * qualifiers}; must not be {@code null}
152   *
153   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement last element} of
154   * this {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
155   *
156   * @exception NullPointerException if any parameter is {@code null}
157   *
158   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
159   */
160  public Path(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
161              final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
162    this(qualifiers, List.of(), lastElement, false);
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Creates a new {@link Path}.
167   *
168   * @param qualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers()
169   * qualifiers}; must not be {@code null}
170   *
171   * @param elements the {@linkplain Element elements} of this {@link
172   * Path}; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
173   * List#isEmpty() empty}
174   *
175   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement last element} of
176   * this {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
177   *
178   * @exception NullPointerException if any parameter is {@code null}
179   */
180  public Path(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
181              final List<? extends Element<?>> elements,
182              final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
183    this(qualifiers, elements, lastElement, false);
184  }
185
186  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
187  private Path(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
188               final List<? extends Element<?>> elements,
189               final Element<? extends T> lastElement,
190               final boolean transliterated) {
191    super();
192    final int size = elements.size();
193    if (size > 0) {
194      Map<String, Object> pathQualifiers = null;
195      final List<Element<?>> newList = new ArrayList<>(size + 1);
196      StringBuilder prefix = null;
197      for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
198        final Element<?> e = elements.get(i);
199        newList.add(e);
200        final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> eQualifiers = e.qualifiers();
201        if (!eQualifiers.isEmpty()) {
202          if (prefix == null) {
203            prefix = new StringBuilder();
204          }
205          if (pathQualifiers == null) {
206            pathQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(qualifiers.toMap());
207          }
208          prefix.append(e.name()).append(PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR);
209          final String finalPrefix = prefix.toString();
210          pathQualifiers.putAll(((Qualifiers<String, Object>)eQualifiers).withPrefix(k -> finalPrefix + PREFIX_SEPARATOR + k).toMap());
211        }
212      }
213      newList.add(lastElement);
214      this.elements = Collections.unmodifiableList(newList);
215      final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> lastElementQualifiers = lastElement.qualifiers();
216      if (lastElementQualifiers.isEmpty()) {
217        if (pathQualifiers == null) {
218          this.qualifiers = (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
219        } else {
220          this.qualifiers = new Qualifiers<>(pathQualifiers);
221        }
222      } else {
223        if (prefix == null) {
224          prefix = new StringBuilder();
225        }
226        if (pathQualifiers == null) {
227          pathQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(qualifiers.toMap());
228        }
229        final String finalPrefix = prefix.append(lastElement.name()).toString();
230        pathQualifiers.putAll(lastElement.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> finalPrefix + PREFIX_SEPARATOR + k).toMap());
231        this.qualifiers = new Qualifiers<>(pathQualifiers);
232      }
233    } else {
234      this.elements = List.of(lastElement);
235      final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> lastElementQualifiers = lastElement.qualifiers();
236      if (lastElementQualifiers.isEmpty()) {
237        this.qualifiers = (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
238      } else {
239        final Map<String, Object> pathQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(qualifiers.toMap());
240        pathQualifiers.putAll(lastElement.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> lastElement.name() + PREFIX_SEPARATOR + k).toMap());
241        this.qualifiers = new Qualifiers<>(pathQualifiers);
242      }
243    }
244    this.transliterated = transliterated;
245  }
246
247
248  /*
249   * Instance methods.
250   */
251
252
253  /**
254   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Path} is the
255   * result of a call to {@link #transliterate(BiFunction)}.
256   *
257   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} is {@linkplain
258   * #transliterate(BiFunction) transliterated}; {@code false}
259   * otherwise
260   */
261  public final boolean transliterated() {
262    return this.transliterated;
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * <em>Transliterates</em> this {@link Path} into another,
267   * semantically equivalent {@link Path} by producing a {@link Path}
268   * that is otherwise equal to this {@link Path} but that will return
269   * {@code true} from its {@link #transliterated()} method.
270   *
271   * <p>Transliteration can be needed when a {@link Path} is defined
272   * by a Java class and used by an application containing that Java
273   * class&mdash;because another Java class may have used the same
274   * element names to refer to different things.</p>
275   *
276   * <p>If this {@link Path} {@linkplain #transliterated() is
277   * already transliterated} then it is returned.</p>
278   *
279   * <p>This method calls {@link #transliterate(BiFunction)} with
280   * {@code null} as its sole argument.</p>
281   *
282   * @return the transliterated {@link Path}, which may be this {@link
283   * Path}; never {@code null}
284   *
285   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
286   *
287   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
288   *
289   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
290   * threads.
291   *
292   * @see #transliterate(BiFunction)
293   *
294   * @see #transliterated()
295   */
296  public final Path<T> transliterate() {
297    return transliterate(null);
298  }
299
300  /**
301   * <em>Transliterates</em> this {@link Path} into another,
302   * semantically equivalent {@link Path} by applying the supplied
303   * {@link BiFunction}, and returns the transliterated {@link Path}.
304   *
305   * <p>The supplied {@link BiFunction} accepts a Java package name as
306   * its first argument, which will be the first package name
307   * {@linkplain StackWalker encountered in the current thread's
308   * stack} that identifies a caller whose package name is not equal
309   * to {@link Class#getPackageName() Path.class.getPackageName()}.
310   * Its second argument is a {@link Element Element} from this
311   * {@link Path}.  It must return a {@link Element} representing the
312   * transliteration of its second argument (which may be the second
313   * argument itself).</p>
314   *
315   * <p>Transliteration can be needed when a {@link Path} is defined
316   * by a Java class and used by an application containing that Java
317   * class&mdash;because another Java class may have used the same
318   * element names to refer to different things.</p>
319   *
320   * <p>If this {@link Path} {@linkplain #transliterated() is
321   * already transliterated} then it is returned.</p>
322   *
323   * @param f a {@link BiFunction} responsible for the
324   * transliteration, element by element; may be {@code null}
325   *
326   * @return the transliterated {@link Path}, which may be this {@link
327   * Path}; never {@code null}
328   *
329   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
330   *
331   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic, but the
332   * supplied {@link BiFunction} may not be.
333   *
334   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
335   * threads, but the supplied {@link BiFunction} may not be.
336   *
337   * @see #transliterated()
338   */
339  @Experimental
340  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
341  public final Path<T> transliterate(final BiFunction<? super String, ? super Element<?>, ? extends Element<?>> f) {
342    if (this.transliterated()) {
343      return this;
344    } else {
345      final int size = this.size();
346      final int lastIndex = size - 1;
347      if (f == null) {
348        return
349          new Path<T>(this.qualifiers(),
350                      this.elements.subList(0, lastIndex),
351                      (Element<? extends T>)this.elements.get(lastIndex),
352                      true);
353      } else {
354        final String userPackageName = stackWalker.walk(Path::findUserPackageName);
355        final List<Element<?>> newElements = new ArrayList<>(lastIndex);
356        for (int i = 0; i < lastIndex; i++) {
357          newElements.add(f.apply(userPackageName, this.elements.get(i)));
358        }
359        return
360          new Path<T>(this.qualifiers(),
361                      newElements,
362                      (Element<? extends T>)f.apply(userPackageName, this.elements.get(lastIndex)),
363                      true);
364      }
365    }
366  }
367
368  /**
369   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
370   * representing this {@link Path}, or an {@linkplain
371   * Optional#isEmpty() empty <code>Optional</code>} if this {@link
372   * Path} cannot be represented as a {@link ConstantDesc}.
373   *
374   * <p>A {@link Path} instance may be represented by a {@link
375   * ConstantDesc} only when the return value of an invocation of the
376   * {@link Element#describeConstable()} method on its {@linkplain
377   * #lastElement() last element} returns a non-{@linkplain
378   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional}.</p>
379   *
380   * @return an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
381   * representing this {@link Path}; never {@code null}; possibly
382   * {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty}
383   *
384   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
385   *
386   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
387   *
388   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
389   * threads.
390   *
391   * @see Element#describeConstable()
392   */
393  @Override // Constable
394  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
395    if (this.isRoot()) {
396      return
397        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
398                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
399                                                CD_Path,
400                                                MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
401                                                                          CD_Path,
402                                                                          "root",
403                                                                          MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_Path))));
404    } else {
405      final ConstantDesc qualifiers = this.qualifiers().describeConstable().orElse(null);
406      if (qualifiers != null) {
407        final ConstantDesc elements = Constables.describeConstable(this.elements.subList(0, this.size() - 1)).orElse(null);
408        if (elements != null) {
409          final ConstantDesc lastElement = this.elements.get(this.size() - 1).describeConstable().orElse(null);
410          if (lastElement != null) {
411            return
412              Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
413                                                      DEFAULT_NAME,
414                                                      CD_Path,
415                                                      MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_Path,
416                                                                                     CD_Qualifiers,
417                                                                                     CD_List,
418                                                                                     CD_PathElement,
419                                                                                     CD_boolean),
420                                                      qualifiers,
421                                                      elements,
422                                                      lastElement,
423                                                      this.transliterated ? TRUE : FALSE));
424          }
425        }
426      }
427    }
428    return Optional.empty();
429  }

431  /**
432   * Returns the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link Path}.
433   *
434   * @return the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link Path}
435   *
436   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
437   *
438   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
439   *
440   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
441   * threads.
442   */
443  @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
444  public final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers() {
445    return this.qualifiers;
446  }

448  /**
449   * Returns the {@link Path.Element} found at the supplied zero-based
450   * index.
451   *
452   * @param index the index of the {@link Path.Element} to return;
453   * must be {@code 0} or greater and less than this {@link Path}'s
454   * {@linkplain #size() size}
455   *
456   * @return the {@link Path.Element} found at the supplied zero-based
457   * index
458   *
459   * @exception IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code index} does not
460   * meet the requirements described above
461   *
462   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
463   *
464   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
465   * threads.
466   *
467   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
468   */
469  public final Element<?> get(final int index) {
470    return this.elements.get(index);
471  }
472
473  /**
474   * Returns an {@link Iterator} that iterates over the {@linkplain
475   * Element elements} of this {@link Path}, including the {@linkplain
476   * #lastElement() last element}.
477   *
478   * @return an {@link Iterator} that iterates over the {@linkplain
479   * Element elements} of this {@link Path}, including the {@linkplain
480   * #lastElement() last element}
481   *
482   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
483   *
484   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
485   *
486   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
487   * threads.
488   */
489  @Override // Iterable<Element<?>>
490  public final Iterator<Element<?>> iterator() {
491    return this.elements.iterator();
492  }
493

501   * #lastElement() last element}

504   *
505   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
506   *
507   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
508   * threads.
509   */
510  @Override // Iterable<Element<?>>
511  public final Spliterator<Element<?>> spliterator() {
512    return this.elements.spliterator();
513  }

528  public final Stream<Element<?>> stream() {
529    return this.elements.stream();
530  }

535   *
536   * @return a possibly parallel {@link Stream} of this {@link Path}'s

538   *

542   *
543   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple

546  public final Stream<Element<?>> parallelStream() {
547    return this.elements.parallelStream();

550  /**
551   * Returns the number of {@link Element}s in this {@link Path},
552   * which is always greater than or equal to {@code 1}.
553   *
554   * @return the number of {@link Element}s in this {@link Path}
555   *
556   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
557   *
558   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
559   * threads.
560   */
561  public final int size() {
562    return this.elements.size();
563  }
564
565  /**
566   * Returns the zero-based index identifying the position of the
567   * first occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
568   * equal to} the supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or
569   * a negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur
570   * within this {@link Path}.
571   *
572   * @param other the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
573   *
574   * @return the zero-based index identifying the position of the
575   * first occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
576   * equal to} supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or a
577   * negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur within
578   * this {@link Path}
579   *
580   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
581   *
582   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
583   *
584   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
585   * threads.
586   */
587  public final int indexOf(final Path<?> other) {
588    return other == this ? 0 : Collections.indexOfSubList(this.elements, other.elements);
589  }
590
591  /**
592   * Returns the zero-based index identifying the position of the
593   * first occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
594   * equal to} supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or a
595   * negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur within
596   * this {@link Path}.
597   *
598   * <p>The supplied {@link BiPredicate} is used to test each {@link
599   * Element} of the supplied {@link Path} against {@link Element}s
600   * from this {@link Path}.  The first argument is an {@link Element}
601   * drawn from this {@link Path}.  The second argument is an {@link
602   * Element} drawn from the supplied {@link Path}.  The {@link
603   * BiPredicate} returns {@code true} if its arguments are deemed to
604   * match.  The supplied {@link BiPredicate}'s {@link
605   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object)} method must be idempotent and
606   * deterministic.</p>
607   *
608   * @param path the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
609   *
610   * @param p the {@link BiPredicate} used to {@linkplain
611   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object) test} {@link Element}s; must not
612   * be {@code null}
613   *
614   * @return the zero-based index identifying the position of the
615   * first occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
616   * equal to} supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or a
617   * negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur within
618   * this {@link Path}
619   *
620   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code path} or {@code
621   * p} is {@code null}
622   *
623   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
624   *
625   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
626   * threads.
627   */
628  public final int indexOf(final Path<?> path, final BiPredicate<? super Element<?>, ? super Element<?>> p) {
629    final int pathSize = path.size();
630    final int sizeDiff = this.size() - pathSize;
631    OUTER_LOOP:
632    for (int i = 0; i <= sizeDiff; i++) {
633      for (int j = 0, k = i; j < pathSize; j++, k++) {
634        if (!p.test(this.elements.get(k), path.elements.get(j))) {
635          continue OUTER_LOOP;
636        }
637      }
638      return i;
639    }
640    return -1;
641  }
642
643  /**
644   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Path} starts with a {@link
645   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
646   * {@link Path}.
647   *
648   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if:</p>
649   *
650   * <ul>
651   *
652   * <li>{@code other} is identical to this {@link Path}, or</li>
653   *
654   * <li>An invocation of the {@link #indexOf(Path)} method with
655   * {@code other} as its sole argument returns {@code 0}</li>
656   *
657   * </ul>
658   *
659   * @param other the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
660   *
661   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} starts with a {@link
662   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
663   * {@link Path}; {@code false} otherwise
664   *
665   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
666   *
667   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
668   *
669   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
670   * threads.
671   *
672   * @see #indexOf(Path)
673   */
674  public final boolean startsWith(final Path<?> other) {
675    return other == this || this.indexOf(other) == 0;
676  }
677
678  /**
679   * Returns the last {@link Element} in this {@link Path}.
680   *
681   * @return the last {@link Element} in this {@link Path}
682   *
683   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
684   *
685   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
686   *
687   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
688   * threads.
689   */
690  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
691  public final Element<T> lastElement() {
692    return (Element<T>)this.elements.get(this.size() - 1);
693  }
694
695  /**
696   * Returns the zero-based index identifying the position of the
697   * last occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
698   * equal to} the supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or
699   * a negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur
700   * within this {@link Path}.
701   *
702   * @param other the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
703   *
704   * @return the zero-based index identifying the position of the
705   * last occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
706   * equal to} supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or a
707   * negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur within
708   * this {@link Path}
709   *
710   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
711   *
712   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
713   *
714   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
715   * threads.
716   */
717  public final int lastIndexOf(final Path<?> other) {
718    return other == this ? 0 : Collections.lastIndexOfSubList(this.elements, other.elements);
719  }
720
721  /**
722   * Returns the zero-based index identifying the position of the
723   * last occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
724   * equal to} supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or a
725   * negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur within
726   * this {@link Path}.
727   *
728   * <p>The supplied {@link BiPredicate} is used to test each {@link
729   * Element} of the supplied {@link Path} against {@link Element}s
730   * from this {@link Path}.  The first argument is an {@link Element}
731   * drawn from this {@link Path}.  The second argument is an {@link
732   * Element} drawn from the supplied {@link Path}.  The {@link
733   * BiPredicate} returns {@code true} if its arguments are deemed to
734   * match.  The supplied {@link BiPredicate}'s {@link
735   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object)} method must be idempotent and
736   * deterministic.</p>
737   *
738   * @param path the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
739   *
740   * @param p the {@link BiPredicate} used to {@linkplain
741   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object) test} {@link Element}s; must not
742   * be {@code null}
743   *
744   * @return the zero-based index identifying the position of the
745   * last occurrence of a {@link Path} {@linkplain #equals(Object)
746   * equal to} supplied {@link Path} within this {@link Path}, or a
747   * negative value if the supplied {@link Path} does not occur within
748   * this {@link Path}
749   *
750   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code path} or {@code
751   * p} is {@code null}
752   *
753   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
754   *
755   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
756   * threads.
757   */
758  public final int lastIndexOf(final Path<?> path, final BiPredicate<? super Element<?>, ? super Element<?>> p) {
759    final int pathSize = path.size();
760    final int sizeDiff = this.size() - pathSize;
761    OUTER_LOOP:
762    for (int i = sizeDiff; i >= 0; i--) {
763      for (int j = 0, k = i; j < pathSize; j++, k++) {
764        if (!p.test(this.elements.get(k), path.elements.get(j))) {
765          continue OUTER_LOOP;
766        }
767      }
768      return i;
769    }
770    return -1;
771  }
772
773/**
774   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Path} starts with a {@link
775   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
776   * {@link Path}.
777   *
778   * <p>The supplied {@link BiPredicate} is used to test each {@link
779   * Element} of the supplied {@link Path} against {@link Element}s
780   * from this {@link Path}.  The first argument is an {@link Element}
781   * drawn from this {@link Path}.  The second argument is an {@link
782   * Element} drawn from the supplied {@link Path}.  The {@link
783   * BiPredicate} returns {@code true} if its arguments are deemed to
784   * match.  The supplied {@link BiPredicate}'s {@link
785   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object)} method must be idempotent and
786   * deterministic.</p>
787   *
788   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if:</p>
789   *
790   * <ul>
791   *
792   * <li>{@code other} is identical to this {@link Path}, or</li>
793   *
794   * <li>An invocation of the {@link #indexOf(Path, BiPredicate)}
795   * method with {@code other} and {@code p} as its arguments returns
796   * {@code 0}</li>
797   *
798   * </ul>
799   *
800   * @param other the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
801   *
802   * @param p the {@link BiPredicate} used to {@linkplain
803   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object) test} {@link Element}s; must not
804   * be {@code null}
805   *
806   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} starts with a {@link
807   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
808   * {@link Path}; {@code false} otherwise
809   *
810   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
811   *
812   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
813   *
814   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
815   * threads.
816   *
817   * @see #indexOf(Path, BiPredicate)
818   */
819  public final boolean startsWith(final Path<?> other, final BiPredicate<? super Element<?>, ? super Element<?>> p) {
820    return other == this || this.indexOf(other, p) == 0;
821  }
822
823  /**
824   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Path} ends with a {@link
825   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
826   * {@link Path}.
827   *
828   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if:</p>
829   *
830   * <ul>
831   *
832   * <li>{@code other} is identical to this {@link Path}, or</li>
833   *
834   * <li>An invocation of the {@link #lastIndexOf(Path)} method with
835   * {@code other} as its sole argument returns {@code 0} or a
836   * positive {@code int}, and that number plus the supplied {@link
837   * Path}'s {@linkplain #size() size} is equal to this {@link Path}'s
838   * {@linkplain #size() size}</li>
839   *
840   * </ul>
841   *
842   * @param other the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
843   *
844   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} ends with a {@link
845   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
846   * {@link Path}; {@code false} otherwise
847   *
848   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
849   *
850   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
851   *
852   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
853   * threads.
854   *
855   * @see #lastIndexOf(Path)
856   */
857  public final boolean endsWith(final Path<?> other) {
858    if (other == this) {
859      return true;
860    } else {
861      final int lastIndex = this.lastIndexOf(other);
862      return lastIndex >= 0 && lastIndex + other.size() == this.size();
863    }
864  }
865
866  /**
867   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Path} ends with a {@link
868   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
869   * {@link Path}.
870   *
871   * <p>The supplied {@link BiPredicate} is used to test each {@link
872   * Element} of the supplied {@link Path} against {@link Element}s
873   * from this {@link Path}.  The first argument is an {@link Element}
874   * drawn from this {@link Path}.  The second argument is an {@link
875   * Element} drawn from the supplied {@link Path}.  The {@link
876   * BiPredicate} returns {@code true} if its arguments are deemed to
877   * match.  The supplied {@link BiPredicate}'s {@link
878   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object)} method must be idempotent and
879   * deterministic.</p>
880   *
881   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if:</p>
882   *
883   * <ul>
884   *
885   * <li>{@code other} is identical to this {@link Path}, or</li>
886   *
887   * <li>An invocation of the {@link #indexOf(Path, BiPredicate)}
888   * method with {@code other} and {@code p} as its arguments returns
889   * {@code 0} or a positive {@code int}, and if that number plus the
890   * supplied {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #size() size} is equal to
891   * this {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #size() size}</li>
892   *
893   * </ul>
894   *
895   * @param other the other {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
896   *
897   * @param p the {@link BiPredicate} used to {@linkplain
898   * BiPredicate#test(Object, Object) test} {@link Element}s; must not
899   * be {@code null}
900   *
901   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} ends with a {@link
902   * Path} that is {@linkplain #equals(Object) equal to} the supplied
903   * {@link Path}; {@code false} otherwise
904   *
905   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
906   *
907   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
908   *
909   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
910   * threads.
911   *
912   * @see #lastIndexOf(Path, BiPredicate)
913   */
914  public final boolean endsWith(final Path<?> other, final BiPredicate<? super Element<?>, ? super Element<?>> p) {
915    if (other == this) {
916      return true;
917    } else {
918      final int lastIndex = this.lastIndexOf(other, p);
919      return lastIndex >= 0 && lastIndex + other.size() == this.size();
920    }
921  }
922
923  /**
924   * Calls the {@link Element#qualified()} method on the {@linkplain
925   * lastElement() last element in this <code>Path</code>} and returns
926   * the result.
927   *
928   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Element#qualified()}
929   * method on the {@linkplain lastElement() last element in this
930   * <code>Path</code>}
931   *
932   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
933   *
934   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
935   *
936   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
937   * threads.
938   */
939  @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
940  public final T qualified() {
941    return this.lastElement().qualified();
942  }
943
944  /**
945   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Path} is a <em>root
946   * path</em>, which is true when it has only one {@linkplain Element
947   * element} and that {@linkplain Element element} {@linkplain
948   * Element#isRoot() is root}.
949   *
950   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} is a <em>root
951   * path</em>; {@code false} otherwise
952   *
953   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
954   *
955   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
956   * threads.
957   */
958  public final boolean isRoot() {
959    return this.size() == 1 && this.lastElement().isRoot();
960  }
961
962  /**
963   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Path} is
964   * <em>absolute</em>, which means that its first {@link Element} is
965   * a {@linkplain Element#isRoot() root} {@link Element}.
966   *
967   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Path} is absolute
968   */
969  public final boolean absolute() {
970    return this.elements.get(0).isRoot();
971  }
972
973  /**
974   * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Path}.
975   *
976   * @return a hashcode for this {@link Path}
977   *
978   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
979   *
980   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
981   * threads.
982   */
983  @Override // Object
984  public final int hashCode() {
985    int hashCode = 17;
986    Object value = this.qualifiers();
987    int c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
988    hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
989    value = this.elements;
990    c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
991    hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
992    c = this.transliterated ? 1 : 0;
993    hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
994    return hashCode;
995  }
996
997  /**
998   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Object}
999   * is equal to this {@link Path}.
1000   *
1001   * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null} in
1002   * which case {@code false} will be returned
1003   *
1004   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Object}
1005   * is equal to this {@link Path}
1006   *
1007   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1008   *
1009   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1010   * threads.
1011   */
1012  @Override // Object
1013  public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
1014    if (other == this) {
1015      return true;
1016    } else if (other != null && other.getClass() == this.getClass()) {
1017      final Path<?> her = (Path<?>)other;
1018      return
1019        Objects.equals(this.qualifiers(), her.qualifiers()) &&
1020        Objects.equals(this.elements, her.elements) &&
1021        this.transliterated == her.transliterated;
1022    } else {
1023      return false;
1024    }
1025  }
1026
1027  /**
1028   * Returns a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
1029   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} and
1030   * {@linkplain Element elments} plus the supplied {@linkplain
1031   * Element element}.
1032   *
1033   * @param <U> the type of the new {@link Path}
1034   *
1035   * @param element the new {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #lastElement()
1036   * last element}; must not be {@code null}
1037   *
1038   * @return a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
1039   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} and
1040   * {@linkplain Element elments} plus the supplied {@linkplain
1041   * Element element}
1042   *
1043   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code element} is {@code
1044   * null}
1045   *
1046   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1047   *
1048   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1049   *
1050   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1051   * threads.
1052   */
1053  public final <U> Path<U> plus(final Element<? extends U> element) {
1054    return new Path<>(this.qualifiers(), this.elements, element);
1055  }
1056
1057  /**
1058   * Returns a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
1059   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link
1060   * Path}'s elements, the supplied {@code elements}, and the supplied
1061   * {@code lastElement}.
1062   *
1063   * @param <U> the type of the new {@link Path}
1064   *
1065   * @param elements additional {@linkplain Element elements}; must
1066   * not be {@code null}
1067   *
1068   * @param lastElement the new {@link Path}'s {@linkplain
1069   * #lastElement() last element}; must not be {@code null}
1070   *
1071   * @return a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
1072   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link
1073   * Path}'s elements, the supplied {@code elements}, and the supplied
1074   * {@code lastElement}
1075   *
1076   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code element} is {@code
1077   * null}
1078   *
1079   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1080   *
1081   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1082   *
1083   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1084   * threads.
1085   */
1086  public final <U> Path<U> plus(final Collection<? extends Element<?>> elements,
1087                                final Element<? extends U> lastElement) {
1088    final List<Element<?>> newElements = new ArrayList<>(this.size() + elements.size());
1089    newElements.addAll(elements);
1090    return new Path<>(this.qualifiers(), newElements, lastElement);
1091  }
1092
1093  /**
1094   * Returns a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
1095   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} combined
1096   * with a prefixed version of the supplied {@link Path}'s
1097   * {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link Path}'s
1098   * elements, the supplied {@link Path}'s elements, and the supplied
1099   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #lastElement() last element}.
1100   *
1101   * <p>The new {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}
1102   * are those of this {@link Path} plus those of the supplied {@link
1103   * Path}, where each qualifier in the supplied {@link Path}'s
1104   * {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} has been prefixed with a
1105   * {@link String} formed from the {@linkplain Element#name() names}
1106   * of all the {@linkplain Element elements} in this {@link
1107   * Path}.</p>
1108   *
1109   * @param <U> the type of the new {@link Path}
1110   *
1111   * @param path the {@link Path} to logically append; must not be
1112   * {@code null}
1113   *
1114   * @return a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
1115   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} combined
1116   * with a prefixed version of the supplied {@link Path}'s
1117   * {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link Path}'s
1118   * elements, the supplied {@link Path}'s elements, and the supplied
1119   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #lastElement() last element}
1120   *
1121   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
1122   *
1123   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1124   *
1125   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1126   *
1127   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1128   * threads.
1129   */
1130  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1131  public final <U> Path<U> plus(final Path<? extends U> path) {
1132    final int pathSize = path.size();
1133    final List<Element<?>> newElements = new ArrayList<>(this.size() + pathSize);
1134    newElements.addAll(this.elements);
1135    final int lastIndex = pathSize - 1;
1136    for (int i = 0; i < lastIndex; i++) {
1137      newElements.add(path.elements.get(i));
1138    }
1139    final String prefix = this.prefix();
1140    return
1141      new Path<>(path.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> prefix + k),
1142                 newElements,
1143                 (Element<? extends U>)path.elements.get(lastIndex));
1144  }
1145
1146  private final String prefix() {
1147    final StringBuilder prefix = new StringBuilder();
1148    for (final Element<?> e : this) {
1149      prefix.append(e.name()).append(PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR);
1150    }
1151    return prefix.toString();
1152  }
1153
1154  /**
1155   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link String} representation of this
1156   * {@link Path}.
1157   *
1158   * <p>The format of the returned {@link String} is deliberately
1159   * undefined and may change between revisions of this class without
1160   * notice.</p>
1161   *
1162   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link String} representation of this
1163   * {@link Path}
1164   *
1165   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1166   *
1167   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1168   *
1169   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1170   * threads.
1171   */
1172  @Override // Object
1173  public final String toString() {
1174    final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1175    Iterator<Element<?>> i = this.iterator();
1176    while (i.hasNext()) {
1177      sb.append(i.next());
1178      if (i.hasNext()) {
1179        sb.append('/');
1180      }
1181    }
1182    sb.append(this.qualifiers());
1183    return sb.toString();
1184  }

1275  /**
1276   * Returns a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
1277   * {@link Element}s formed from the supplied {@code qualified} and
1278   * the supplied array of {@linkplain Element#name() names}.
1279   *
1280   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
1281   *
1282   * @param qualified the {@linkplain Element#qualified() qualified
1283   * item} of what will be the last {@link Element}
1284   *
1285   * @param names an array of {@linkplain Element#name() names} from
1286   * which {@link Element}s will be synthesized; must not be {@code
1287   * null}
1288   *
1289   * @return a {@link Path}
1290   *
1291   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code names} is {@code null}
1292   *
1293   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1294   * {@code null} and the last element of {@code names} {@linkplain
1295   * String#isEmpty() is an empty <code>String</code>}
1296   *
1297   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1298   *
1299   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1300   *
1301   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1302   * threads.
1303   *
1304   * @see #of(Object, List)
1305   */
1306  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final T qualified, final String... names) {
1307    return Path.of(qualified, Arrays.asList(names));
1308  }
1309
1310  /**
1311   * Returns a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
1312   * the supplied {@code lastElement}.
1313   *
1314   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
1315   *
1316   * @param lastElement the last {@link Element}; must not be {@code
1317   * null}
1318   *
1319   * @return a {@link Path}
1320   *
1321   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code lastElement} is {@code
1322   * null}
1323   *
1324   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1325   *
1326   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1327   *
1328   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1329   * threads.
1330   */
1331  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
1332    return new Path<>(lastElement);
1333  }
1334
1335  /**
1336   * Returns a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
1337   * {@link Element}s formed from the supplied {@code qualified} and
1338   * the supplied {@link List} of {@linkplain Element#name() names}.
1339   *
1340   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
1341   *
1342   * @param qualified the {@linkplain Element#qualified() qualified
1343   * item} of what will be the last {@link Element}
1344   *
1345   * @param names a {@link List} of {@linkplain Element#name() names}
1346   * from which {@link Element}s will be synthesized; must not be
1347   * {@code null}
1348   *
1349   * @return a {@link Path}
1350   *
1351   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code names} is {@code null}
1352   *
1353   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1354   * {@code null} and the last element of {@code names} {@linkplain
1355   * String#isEmpty() is an empty <code>String</code>}
1356   *
1357   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1358   *
1359   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1360   *
1361   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1362   * threads.
1363   *
1364   * @see Element#Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
1365   */
1366  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final T qualified, final List<? extends String> names) {
1367    final int lastIndex = names.size() - 1;
1368    final List<Element<Object>> elements;
1369    switch (lastIndex) {
1370    case -1:
1371      return new Path<>(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), Element.of(qualified, null));
1372    case 0:
1373      return new Path<>(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), Element.of(qualified, names.get(0)));
1374    default:
1375      elements = new ArrayList<>(lastIndex);
1376      for (int i = 0; i < lastIndex; i++) {
1377        final String name = names.get(i);
1378        elements.add(Element.of(name));
1379      }
1380      return new Path<>(Qualifiers.of(), elements, Element.of(qualified, names.get(lastIndex)));
1381    }
1382  }
1383
1384  /**
1385   * Return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
1386   * the supplied arguments and returns it.
1387   *
1388   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
1389   *
1390   * @param pathQualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@link Qualifiers}; must
1391   * not be {@code null}
1392   *
1393   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement() last
1394   * <code>Element</code>} of the {@link Path}; must not be {@code
1395   * null}
1396   *
1397   * @return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path}
1398   *
1399   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1400   *
1401   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1402   *
1403   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1404   *
1405   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1406   * threads.
1407   *
1408   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
1409   */
1410  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> pathQualifiers,
1411                                     final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
1412    return new Path<>(pathQualifiers, lastElement);
1413  }
1414
1415  /**
1416   * Return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
1417   * the supplied arguments and returns it.
1418   *
1419   * @param <T> the type of the new {@link Path}
1420   *
1421   * @param pathQualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@link Qualifiers}; must
1422   * not be {@code null}
1423   *
1424   * @param elements the interior {@link Element}s of the {@link
1425   * Path}; must not be {@code null}
1426   *
1427   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement() last
1428   * <code>Element</code>} of the {@link Path}; must not be {@code
1429   * null}
1430   *
1431   * @return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path}
1432   *
1433   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1434   *
1435   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1436   *
1437   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1438   *
1439   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1440   * threads.
1441   *
1442   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
1443   */
1444  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> pathQualifiers,
1445                                     final List<? extends Element<?>> elements,
1446                                     final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
1447    return new Path<>(pathQualifiers, elements, lastElement);
1448  }
1449
1450  private static final String findUserPackageName(final Stream<StackFrame> stream) {
1451    final String className = stream.sequential()
1452      .dropWhile(f -> f.getClassName().startsWith(Path.class.getPackageName()))
1453      .dropWhile(f -> f.getClassName().contains(".$Proxy")) // skip JDK proxies (and any other kind of proxies)
1454      .map(StackFrame::getClassName)
1455      .findFirst()
1456      .orElse(null);
1457    if (className == null) {
1458      return "";
1459    } else {
1460      final int lastIndex = className.lastIndexOf('.');
1461      if (lastIndex < 0) {
1462        return "";
1463      } else if (lastIndex == 0) {
1464        throw new AssertionError("className: " + className);
1465      } else {
1466        return className.substring(0, lastIndex);
1467      }
1468    }
1469  }
1470
1471
1472  /*
1473   * Inner and nested classes.
1474   */
1475
1476
1477  /**
1478   * An element normally {@linkplain Path#iterator() within} a {@link
1479   * Path}, consisting of a {@link #qualifiers() Qualifiers}, a
1480   * {@linkplain #name() name}, and an optional {@linkplain
1481   * #qualified() thing that it designates or points to}.
1482   *
1483   * @param <T> the type of this {@link Element}
1484   *
1485   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
1486   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
1487   */
1488  public static final class Element<T> implements Qualified<String, Object, T> {
1489
1490
1491    /*
1492     * Static fields.
1493     */
1494
1495
1496    private static final Element<?> ROOT = new Element<>();
1497
1498
1499    /*
1500     * Instance fields.
1501     */
1502
1503
1504    private final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers;
1505
1506    private final T qualified;
1507
1508    private final String name;
1509
1510
1511    /*
1512     * Constructors.
1513     */
1514
1515
1516    // For use by ROOT only.
1517    private Element() {
1518      super();
1519      this.qualifiers = Qualifiers.of();
1520      this.qualified = null;
1521      this.name = "";
1522    }
1523
1524    /**
1525     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1526     *
1527     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; must not be
1528     * {@code null} or {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty}
1529     *
1530     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
1531     *
1532     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code name} {@linkplain
1533     * String#isEmpty() is empty}
1534     *
1535     * @see #Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
1536     */
1537    public Element(final String name) {
1538      this(Qualifiers.of(), null, name);
1539    }
1540
1541    /**
1542     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1543     *
1544     * @param qualified the thing this {@link Element} describes; may
1545     * be {@code null}
1546     *
1547     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1548     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1549     *
1550     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
1551     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
1552     *
1553     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1554     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
1555     * empty}
1556     *
1557     * @see #Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
1558     */
1559    public Element(final T qualified, final String name) {
1560      this(Qualifiers.of(), qualified, name);
1561    }
1562
1563    /**
1564     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1565     *
1566     * @param qualifiers the {@link Qualifiers} qualifying this {@link
1567     * Element}; may be {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain
1568     * Qualifiers#of() empty <code>Qualifiers</code>} will be used
1569     * instead
1570     *
1571     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1572     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1573     *
1574     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
1575     *
1576     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code name} {@linkplain
1577     * String#isEmpty() is empty}
1578     *
1579     * @see #Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
1580     */
1581    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1582    public Element(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers, final String name) {
1583      super();
1584      if (name == null) {
1585        throw new NullPointerException("name");
1586      } else if (name.isEmpty()) {
1587        throw new IllegalArgumentException("An empty name may not be paired with a null qualified");
1588      } else {
1589        this.name = name;
1590      }
1591      this.qualifiers = qualifiers == null || qualifiers.isEmpty() ? Qualifiers.of() : (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
1592      this.qualified = null;
1593    }
1594
1595    /**
1596     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1597     *
1598     * @param qualifiers the {@link Qualifiers} qualifying this {@link
1599     * Element}; may be {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain
1600     * Qualifiers#of() empty <code>Qualifiers</code>} will be used
1601     * instead
1602     *
1603     * @param qualified the thing this {@link Element} describes; may
1604     * be {@code null}
1605     *
1606     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1607     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1608     *
1609     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
1610     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
1611     *
1612     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1613     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
1614     * empty}
1615     */
1616    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1617    public Element(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers, final T qualified, final String name) {
1618      super();
1619      if (qualified == null) {
1620        if (name == null) {
1621          throw new NullPointerException("name");
1622        } else if (name.isEmpty()) {
1623          throw new IllegalArgumentException("An empty name may not be paired with a null qualified");
1624        } else {
1625          this.name = name;
1626        }
1627      } else {
1628        this.name = name == null ? "" : name;
1629      }
1630      this.qualifiers = qualifiers == null || qualifiers.isEmpty() ? Qualifiers.of() : (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
1631      this.qualified = qualified;
1632    }
1633
1634
1635    /*
1636     * Instance methods.
1637     */
1638
1639
1640    /**
1641     * Returns an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
1642     * representing this {@link Element}.
1643     *
1644     * @return an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
1645     * representing this {@link Element}; never {@code null}; possibly
1646     * {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty}
1647     *
1648     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1649     *
1650     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1651     *
1652     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1653     * multiple threads.
1654     */
1655    @Override // Constable
1656    public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
1657      if (this.isRoot()) {
1658        return
1659          Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1660                                                  DEFAULT_NAME,
1661                                                  CD_PathElement,
1662                                                  MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
1663                                                                            CD_PathElement,
1664                                                                            "root",
1665                                                                            MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_PathElement))));
1666      } else {
1667        final ConstantDesc qualifiersDesc = this.qualifiers().describeConstable().orElse(null);
1668        if (qualifiersDesc != null) {
1669          final ConstantDesc qualifiedDesc;
1670          final Object qualified = this.qualified();
1671          if (qualified == null) {
1672            qualifiedDesc = NULL;
1673          } else if (qualified instanceof Constable cq) {
1674            qualifiedDesc = cq.describeConstable().orElse(null);
1675          } else if (qualified instanceof ConstantDesc cd) {
1676            qualifiedDesc = cd;
1677          } else {
1678            qualifiedDesc = null;
1679          }
1680          if (qualifiedDesc != null) {
1681            final String name = this.name();
1682            return
1683              Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1684                                                      name,
1685                                                      CD_PathElement,
1686                                                      MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_PathElement,
1687                                                                                     CD_Qualifiers,
1688                                                                                     CD_Object,
1689                                                                                     CD_String),
1690                                                      qualifiersDesc,
1691                                                      qualifiedDesc,
1692                                                      name));
1693          }
1694        }
1695      }
1696      return Optional.empty();
1697    }
1698
1699    /**
1700     * Returns the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link
1701     * Element}.
1702     *
1703     * @return the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link
1704     * Element}
1705     *
1706     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1707     *
1708     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1709     *
1710     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1711     * threads.
1712     */
1713    @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
1714    public final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers() {
1715      return this.qualifiers;
1716    }
1717
1718    /**
1719     * Returns the thing that this {@link Element} describes (which
1720     * may be nothing).
1721     *
1722     * @return the thing that this {@link Element} describes, which
1723     * may be nothing, in which case {@code null} will be returned
1724     *
1725     * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1726     *
1727     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1728     *
1729     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1730     * multiple threads.
1731     */
1732    @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
1733    public final T qualified() {
1734      return this.qualified;
1735    }
1736
1737    /**
1738     * Returns the name of this {@link Element}.
1739     *
1740     * @return the name of this {@link Element}
1741     *
1742     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1743     *
1744     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1745     *
1746     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1747     * multiple threads.
1748     */
1749    public final String name() {
1750      return this.name;
1751    }
1752
1753    /**
1754     * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Element} is a <em>root
1755     * element</em>, which is true when the {@link #qualified()}
1756     * method returns {@code null} and the {@link #name()} method
1757     * returns an {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty
1758     * <code>String</code>}.
1759     *
1760     * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Element} is a
1761     * <em>root element</em>
1762     *
1763     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1764     *
1765     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1766     * multiple threads.
1767     */
1768    public final boolean isRoot() {
1769      return this.qualified() == null && this.name().isEmpty();
1770    }
1771
1772    /**
1773     * Returns a {@link Element}, <strong>usually newly
1774     * created</strong>, whose {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}
1775     * have keys that are prefixed with the supplied {@code prefix}.
1776     *
1777     * @param prefix the prefix to apply; may be {@code null} or
1778     * {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty} in which case {@code this}
1779     * will be returned
1780     *
1781     * @return an {@link Element}, <strong>usually newly
1782     * created</strong>, whose {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}
1783     * have keys that are prefixed with the supplied {@code prefix}
1784     *
1785     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1786     *
1787     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1788     *
1789     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1790     * multiple threads.
1791     */
1792    public final Element<T> withQualifiersPrefix(final String prefix) {
1793      if (prefix == null || prefix.isEmpty()) {
1794        return this;
1795      }
1796      return Element.of(this.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> prefix + k),
1797                        this.qualified(),
1798                        this.name());
1799    }
1800
1801    /**
1802     * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Element}.
1803     *
1804     * @return a hashcode for this {@link Element}
1805     *
1806     * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
1807     *
1808     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1809     * multiple threads.
1810     */
1811    @Override // Object
1812    public final int hashCode() {
1813      int hashCode = 17;
1814      Object value = this.qualified();
1815      int c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
1816      hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
1817      value = this.name();
1818      c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
1819      hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
1820      value = this.qualifiers();
1821      c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
1822      hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
1823      return hashCode;
1824    }
1825
1826    /**
1827     * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1828     * this {@link Element}.
1829     *
1830     * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null} in
1831     * which case {@code false} will be returned
1832     *
1833     * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1834     * this {@link Element}; {@code false} otherwise
1835     *
1836     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1837     *
1838     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1839     * multiple threads.
1840     */
1841    @Override // Object
1842    public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
1843      if (this == other) {
1844        return true;
1845      } else if (other != null && this.getClass() == other.getClass()) {
1846        final Element<?> her = (Element<?>)other;
1847        return
1848          Objects.equals(this.qualified(), her.qualified()) &&
1849          Objects.equals(this.name(), her.name()) &&
1850          Objects.equals(this.qualifiers(), her.qualifiers());
1851      } else {
1852        return false;
1853      }
1854    }
1855
1856    /**
1857     * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link String} representation of
1858     * this {@link Element}.
1859     *
1860     * <p>The format of the {@link String} that is returned is
1861     * deliberately unspecified and subject to change without notice
1862     * from version to version of this class.</p>
1863     *
1864     * @return a {@link String} representation of this {@link Element}
1865     *
1866     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}
1867     *
1868     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1869     *
1870     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1871     * multiple threads.
1872     */
1873    @Override // Object
1874    public final String toString() {
1875      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1876      final T qualified = this.qualified();
1877      if (qualified != null) {
1878        // Handle the extremely common case that qualified is a Type.
1879        sb.append(qualified instanceof Type t ? t.getTypeName() : qualified).append(':');
1880      }
1881      sb.append(name);
1882      final Map<?, ?> map = this.qualifiers().toMap();
1883      if (!map.isEmpty()) {
1884        sb.append(map);
1885      }
1886      return sb.toString();
1887    }
1888
1889
1890    /*
1891     * Static methods.
1892     */
1893
1894
1895    /**
1896     * Returns a {@link Element} that {@linkplain #isRoot() is a
1897     * <em>root element</em>}.
1898     *
1899     * @return an {@link Element} that {@linkplain #isRoot() is a
1900     * <em>root element</em>}
1901     *
1902     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1903     *
1904     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1905     *
1906     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1907     * multiple threads.
1908     */
1909    public static final Element<?> root() {
1910      return ROOT;
1911    }
1912
1913    /**
1914     * Returns a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments.
1915     *
1916     * <p>The returned {@link Element} may be newly created or it may
1917     * be cached.  No assumption must be made about its identity.</p>
1918     *
1919     * @param <T> the type of this {@link Element}
1920     *
1921     * @param qualifiers the {@link Qualifiers} qualifying this {@link
1922     * Element}; may be {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain
1923     * Qualifiers#of() empty <code>Qualifiers</code>} will be used
1924     * instead
1925     *
1926     * @param qualified the thing this {@link Element} describes; may
1927     * be {@code null}
1928     *
1929     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1930     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1931     *
1932     * @return a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments
1933     *
1934     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
1935     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
1936     *
1937     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1938     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
1939     * empty}
1940     *
1941     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1942     *
1943     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1944     *
1945     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1946     * multiple threads.
1947     */
1948    public static final <T> Element<T> of(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
1949                                          final T qualified,
1950                                          final String name) {
1951      return new Element<>(qualifiers, qualified, name);
1952    }
1953
1954    /**
1955     * Returns a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments.
1956     *
1957     * <p>The returned {@link Element} may be newly created or it may
1958     * be cached.  No assumption must be made about its identity.</p>
1959     *
1960     * @param <T> the type of this {@link Element}
1961     *
1962     * @param qualified the thing this {@link Element} describes; may
1963     * be {@code null}
1964     *
1965     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1966     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1967     *
1968     * @return a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments
1969     *
1970     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
1971     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
1972     *
1973     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1974     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
1975     * empty}
1976     *
1977     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1978     *
1979     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1980     *
1981     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1982     * multiple threads.
1983     */
1984    public static final <T> Element<T> of(final T qualified, final String name) {
1985      return new Element<>(qualified, name);
1986    }
1987
1988    /**
1989     * Returns a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments.
1990     *
1991     * <p>The returned {@link Element} may be newly created or it may
1992     * be cached.  No assumption must be made about its identity.</p>
1993     *
1994     * @param <T> the type of this {@link Element}
1995     *
1996     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1997     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1998     *
1999     * @return a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments
2000     *
2001     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
2002     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
2003     *
2004     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
2005     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
2006     * empty}
2007     *
2008     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
2009     *
2010     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
2011     *
2012     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
2013     * multiple threads.
2014     */
2015    public static final <T> Element<T> of(final String name) {
2016      return new Element<>(name);
2017    }
2018
2019  }

2021}
